definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the early 18 century.

definitions.definition: The vessels by which the processes of absorption are carried on, as the lymphatics in animals, the extremities of the roots in plants .
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 18 century.

definitions.definition: Any substance which absorbs and neutralizes acid fluid in the stomach and bowels , as magnesia , chalk , etc.; also a substance, e.g., iodine , which acts on the absorbent vessels so as to reduce enlarged and indurated parts.
A liquid used in the process of separating gases or volatile liquids, in oil refining.

main_definition: Anything which absorbs . [First attested in the early 18 century.]
secondary_definitions: ( physiology , pluralized , now rare ) The vessels by which the processes of absorption are carried on, as the lymphatics in animals, the extremities of the roots in plants . [First attested in the mid 18 century.]

( medicine ) Any substance which absorbs and neutralizes acid fluid in the stomach and bowels , as magnesia , chalk , etc.; also a substance, e.g., iodine , which acts on the absorbent vessels so as to reduce enlarged and indurated parts.
( physical chemistry ) A liquid used in the process of separating gases or volatile liquids, in oil refining.
